title: Employee abruptly quits after their boss gives them the career runaround for 3 years, boss leaves a strongly-worded note along with their final paycheck: ‘It's so unprofessional’
description: Sometimes, working relationships have the potential to turn into something a bit more personal than what you first intended. You might not feel a certain tethering to a coworker, but they might feel such ways toward you, so it's important to always prioritize your career first and foremost and always look out for your own best interest. If you don't, you might be stuck with a narcissistic colleague or boss and be forced to cut the work relationship off with them completely. One caveat: There will always be hard feelings if clingy working relationships go south. That's just the name of the game, so it's best to get the chip off your shoulder and let the dust settle. Time heals all unwarranted wounds…The employee who posted this next story explains that they needed to leave their place of work after working with their boss for over three years because the "goal post" was always moving in terms of expectations. So, when they quit, their boss, who seems a bit unhinged, gives them their final paycheck with a typed-out letter attached. Scroll to read below…
author: Lana DeGaetano
